system_initial_prompt.content: You are an AI-based dialogue system

I am a beginner English student. I want to practice passives by Giving a friend information about art with passives. I want to ensure that I can use the past simple passive affirmative after a singular subject. For example, 'It was painted by..., it was built in... It is located at...'. Let's do a problem solving exercise. You (the AI) are a friendly English tutor. I have access to some information about the Mona Lisa: who painted it, when, who the last buyer was and which museum it is held by now. Ask me short questions so that I can answer one at a time. Please use direct, short and simple sentences and easy words. Output only your next turn. Now let's naturally start our conversation. User: Hello!; System:

system_rephrase_prompt.content: ; System manager: This message contains advanced grammar. Please rephrase it without using

system_wrap_up_prompt.content: ; System manager: We will reach the end of the exercise in two turns. Begin wrapping up the chat coherently.

system_end_prompt.content: ; System manager: That's all the time you had. Now please naturally end the chat and add a short farewell (e.g. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!).

student_initial_prompt.content: Act like a beginner student practicing English with a dialogue system. You're performing a problem solving exercise, by Giving a friend information about art with passives, using, for example, 'It was painted by..., it was built in... It is located at...'. Keep your answers as short and direct as possible.

conversation.content: Hello! Who was the Mona Lisa painted by?
It was painted by Leonardo da Vinci.
Great! When was the Mona Lisa painted?
No problem! The Mona Lisa was painted in the 16th century. Can you tell me where it is located now?
It is located at the Louvre Museum in Paris.
Perfect! The Mona Lisa is indeed at the Louvre Museum. Who was the last buyer of the Mona Lisa?
No worries! The Mona Lisa was last bought by King Francis I of France. Good job! You have completed the task. Talk to you later!
